extendedInfo.description: Powerful Radio planning in your pocket.See where you can communicate to with the trial version of this unique RF coverage calculator. * THIS APP REQUIRES INTERNET ACCESS AND RADIO KNOWLEDGE IS ESSENTIAL TO USE IT PROPERLY *The trial version has a reduced radius (10km / 6Mi) and frequency limit (500MHz) but the Pro version will do 100km/63Mi radius and up to 20,000MHz as well as let you take them offline for viewing later on the device or Google earth via the SD card.TO USE: Pan the map to zoom to your transmit site then press your menu or keypad centre buttons to access the 'calculate' form. Enter your device's parameters and click the big yellow button to create your coverage. Settings and help are available in the app's menu.This App is ideal for the following technologies and radio user groups:Systems: DAB, DVB, GSM 2G/3G/4G/LTE, Marine VHF, PMR, TETRA, PTT, WiFi, WiMaxGroups: Emergency services (Ambulance, Coastguard, Fire, Forestry, Police), Amateur/Ham enthusiasts, Armed Forces/Military, Construction industry, Event organisers, Government, Maritime/Private Security, WISPs.RFSignal (Trial) features:* GPS enabled for mobile radio users* Latitude/Longitude in decimal degrees* Frequency: 20MHz to 20GHz (VHF-UHF-SHF)* Effective Radiated Power (ERP) in Watts* SRTM2 elevation data with 99% global coverage to 90m accuracy* FULL Google Maps integration with Satellite option* Metric / Imperial units (m / f)* Antenna Polarisation (H / V)* Transmit and Receive mast heights (Above Ground Level)* Receiver sensitivity with colour key* Output as dB, dBm or dBuV/m* Receiver height(s)* Random buildings* Databased buildings* Low, medium and high resolution* Low, medium and high colour schemas* Radius (Kilometres / Miles) up to 10km / 6Mi* Transparency slider* Single or multiple (eg. repeater chain) sites* Save to phone or SD card* Template search by frequency and keywordFull user manual available in app menu or at http://m.cloudrf.com/app/Requirements:1) SD card access - Needed to store the overlay(s).2) Internet connection - to communicate with server.3) GPS - to locate your position for mobile users (opt in)Support: support@cloudrf.com

reviews.title: Cool, however...
reviews.comment: Very cool and accurate. Was enjoying this so much with even the max 15 km radius, that I planned on purchasing the full version. Then I go to use it again, and the max radius was reduced back down to 10km!  I understand the reasons, but I did not expect a rev would further cripple the trial version. My bad for allowing auto updates.
reviews.author: James Brownyard

reviews.title: I really like it :)
reviews.comment: I can see every bit of the WORLD love it but I do sadly have a complaintment about 1 thing hope his helps you :) there has to be an exit button I\'m not to dissupointed about this but pls ad a exit button thank you for your time :)  Your Sinserly -   Tyler Dylan Bailey thank you.
reviews.author: Tyler Bailey

reviews.author: Ayang Ayang

reviews.comment: Bad
reviews.author: Kiril Georgiev

reviews.title: Top app,Top service
reviews.comment: Galaxy Tab P1000 running Android 2.2 Easy install of pro version & it works well. The web version worked well too with more features (ran it in Firefox on Ubuntu Linux.) The Google Earth version is even better, very detailed resolution up to 200km radius. Had some instal issues because my Linux version of Google Earth is not as good as the Windows version. But thats where the developer excelled, prompt to answer emails and helpful with advice to get it running well.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Customer Service Sucks
reviews.comment: In response to my questions, I was rudely told to \"RTFM\". When I go pro, I will give my money to someone who appreciates me as a customer.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.comment: Really handy app for professional radio users. I\'ve found some signal hotspots I never would have thought of. Good documentation even if a little technical in places. Top work dev!
